DOC.brief_title: Effect Vitamin D Replacement Maternal Neonatal Outcomes
DOC.detailed_description: Hypovitaminosis D prevalent worldwide across lifecycle , include pregnant woman , particularly Middle East . It associate adverse maternal neonatal outcome . While Institute Medicine ( IOM ) recommend 600 IU vitamin D per day reach 25-Hydroxyvitamin D ( 25 ( OH ) D ) level ≥ 20 ng/ml , Endocrine Society ( ES ) recommend 1,500-2,000 IU/day reach level ≥ 30 ng/ml , WHO guideline recommend supplementation part routine prenatal care . They however underscore fact subject low level may one benefit vitamin D replacement . The benefit approach dos need reach desirable level test . This randomized trial proposes , test effect two vitamin D dose , low dose 600 IU daily high dose 3,000 IU daily . 280 pregnant woman , 25 ( OH ) D level 10-30 ng/ml early second trimester recruit form American University Beirut-Medical Center ( AUB-MC ) , Rafic Hariri University Hospital ( RHUH ) Bahman Hospital . They randomize , double blinded fashion , receive daily equivalent dos cholecalciferol , 600 IU 3,000 IU delivery . Maternal clinical information food frequency questionnaire obtain visit delivery . Maternal 25 ( OH ) D chemistry , include Calcium , creatinine , lipid profile , glucose Insulin assess study entry , third trimester delivery . Fetal measurement collect study entry second trimester . Neonatal anthropometric variable venous umbilical cord 25 ( OH ) D level measure birth infant also undergo dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry ( DEXA ) scan assessment , bone fat mass , one 6 week . Maternal neonatal genetic study vitamin D gene polymorphism also perform . Throughout study , adverse event collect systematically independent Data Safety Monitoring Board ask review serious adverse event . The percent woman achieve 25 ( OH ) D ≥ 20ng/ml low dose compare high dose use Chi-Square . Independent t-test use compare mean neonatal bone mineral content one month age 2 arm . For outcome , t-test use continuous outcome Chi-square use binary outcome compare mean proportion , respectively . The primary analysis intention-to-treat analysis ( ITT ) unadjusted result . For primary outcome , p- value consider statistically significant ≤ 0.025 . The investigator study would randomize controlled trial Middle East , investigate recommend daily allowance vitamin D , desirable dose optimize neonatal musculoskeletal health , woman low 25 ( OH ) D level , level reflective country Middle East .
DOC.criteria: Pregnant woman gestational age ( GA ) < 14 week screen visit . Middle Eastern woman ( Middle East country define WHO : Bahrain , Egypt , Iran , Iraq , Palestine , Jordan , Kuwait , Lebanon , Oman , Qatar , Saudi Arabia , Syria , , United Arab Emirates , Yemen ) 25 ( OH ) D level 10ng/ml 30ng/ml Age > 18 year Vitamin D supplementation ≤ 200 IU daily ( If daily vitamin D supplementation > 200 IU daily , enrollment , pregnant woman advise adjust prenatal multivitamin dose way total vitamin D supplementation per week n't exceed 1400 IU per week , consultation primary Obstetric Gynecology ( OBGYN ) physician . ) 25 ( OH ) D level < 10 ng/ml > 30 ng/ml . Known metabolic bone disease Current medication likely interfere vitamin D metabolism ( enzyme inducing anticonvulsant , anti TB ) Vitamin D supplementation > 600 IU daily
